teacher_info.intro:
Hello, I'm Lora. 
I was born in mainland China and I am living in HK now. 
I can speak Mandarin, Cantonese, Hakka, English and a little bit Japanese.
I am very interested in language learning, so I can understand the difficulties when you want to learn a new language. I love reading, writing, taking photos and traveling. I have been to many countries in the world, such as Japan, Thailand, Finland, Czech Republic, Germany, Italy, Sweden, Hungary and so on. I love experience different culture and communicate with different people.

Hello everyone.My name is Deliverance.Iâ€˜m from China and I am a native speaker of Chinese.  I can speak not only Mandanrin but also 2 dialects:Cantonese and Hakka.
I have many interests such as watching movies and cartoons,reading books(psychology,education,fairy tales etc.),dancing (Chinese classical dance)and so on.
I gratuated in teaching Chinese as a foreign language , so I would like to help you with my knowledge patiently.Feel free to contact me~

Hi,I'm Tina. å¤§å®¶å¥½ï¼Œæˆ‘æ˜¯Tina. I'm a native mandarin speaker. I can also speak French and English. I was born in Changchun, a city in the north of China. Very standard Chinese is spoken in the beautiful city of Changchun. I graduated from Changchun Foreign language University in 2004. After graduation I work in an international travel agency in Beijing for many years and I have about two years experience in teaching Chinese as a foreign language. I hope to help you improve your Chinese through Italki platform and better understand Chinese culture.

Hi,  Itâ€™s  Bella.
Welcome back to my channel. I am currently studying as a graduate student and my major is teaching Chinese  to Speakers of Other Languages.  My mandarin level is 2A. During holiday, I would go to some educational institutions to teach primary school students Chinese. As for my hobby ,I happen to be good at calligraphy, And I also prefer to do some handcrafts, such as fan or paper lantern those Chinese style pieces ï¼Œ

Hi there, friends. I'm Andy, from Changzhou, mainland China. 
Learning a language has always been one of my biggest interests. It can be a medium to learn the culture and history backed up by this language, and in the process of learning, you probably will find your alter ego, which is pretty exciting, isn't it?
Chinese is one of the oldest languages in the globe and is used by 1.5 billions people or so. I'd like to lead you into the wonderful world of this language, and open a new door to your mind.

NÇ hÇo(Hello)ï¼ŒIâ€™m Yoyo, I was born and grew up in Sichuan province (the hometown of Panda). And I am now studying Japanese. Because I am very interested in Japanese cartoons. Learning a new language takes a lot of efforts. It is both fun and hard. But when I look back and see all the improvements I made, I think all my efforts are worthwhile. I hope you can enjoy your Chinese studying journey too.

My name is Nana. I am a native Chinese, I come from Hunan province. I started teaching Chinese as a second language to foreigners since 2013. I am a certified Chinese teacher from the Confucius Institute. I am an easygoing and patient teacher. I am also open minded to different cultures and languages. Welcome to follow my Instagram account: nananagechinese to learn more Chinese in short videos.

â˜€ï¸Hello! I'm a native Chinese speaker, good at writing, and enjoy taking/giving language classes with people from various counties.

I recommend content-based approach, mixed with natural flow conversations. Apart from textbooks, we can also learn with recipes, stories, news articles, ads, TV shows, or even video games.

Having traveled to many places in and out of China, I'm curious in exploring new worlds and would love to hear your perspectives from another corner of the globe. ğŸ

Hi, I'm Wella from Xi'an, China, where the famous terracotta warriors from! I'm a native Chinese speaker with great passion on language. I'm a freelance English-Chinese interpreter/translator and a freelance photographer as well. I love life which always warms me and surprises me. Sharing and disseminating Chinese culture and language is always where my passion is, and where my responsibility is as a language worker. I'd like to help more people learn practical Mandarin from basis to professional, and feel the fun of it.

Hello, I'm Haley. My hobby is very extensive, such as traveling, reading, listening to music and etc.; In my point of view, i believe that It is better to travel ten thousand miles than to read ten thousand books.

Helloï¼Œeveryoneï¼I'm Lilyã€‚  
   *2years of working experience in primary shool.and like to communicate and be loved by 
    students and parents.
   *English has passed Level 4 (CET4), and  I will try my  best to  explain something  in English 
   *Japanese has passed N1 , and if necessary I can try make the course  in Japanese
   * Easy-going, patient and responsible.
   * Flexible class time

  about language learning ,all we need to do is persist!

My name is Tao. I was born and raised in Wuhan. I am a native Chinese speaker. After working as an English teacher for beginners in an adult English training institution for 2 years, I had a career shift to securities investment. 

I love traveling, history, art, and I am addicted to different cultures. I started my own business as a professional travel planner designing overseas trips for high-net-worth individual 5 years ago. I have  already travelled to 23 countries in the past 7 years and made many local friends during the trips.

I think we can enhance mutual understanding and reduce misunderstandings and conflicts by traveling and communicating with people from all over the world.

Hello, my name is Carrie. I am native Chinese and professional Chinese teacher with 3 years of experience. I have taught foreign students and I hope I can help you too! Provide free course materials including tutorials, notes, etc.
With the conversation on my class, I'll correct students' pronunciation intonation and improve their oral Chinese.
Welcome to my Trial Lesson.
